content: a slouchy hat pattern with instructions for 7 different weights of yarn a simple slip_stitch pattern gives this easy hat a little character you now have one pattern that can be used for any yarn you have because there are instructions for fingering sport dk worsted aran bulky and super bulky weight yarns the weights and yardages used for each hat are included for easy substitution of yarns great for stash busting or handspun yarns included in the pattern are photos a complete list of abbreviations and a stitch glossary experience with knitting in the round is necessary skill level advanced beginner **pattern notes** this hat is worked from the bottom up the ribbing is snug measuring about 16 inches at the top of the ribbing unstretched the body of the hat is loose between 21 and 22 inches i have used several indie yarns in my samples the idea is not to use the yarn i used but to be able to use any yarn you want and match it to the appropriate gauge **fingering weight yarn** approximately 3oz 75g or 300yds used needles 16in circular needle us 1/2 25mm 16in circular needle us 2/2 75mm 1 set us 2/2 75mm double-pointed needles 2 circulars or 1 long circular magic loop for crown decreases gauge 28 - 30 sts = 4in/10cm in stockinette stitch **sport weight yarn** approximately 2 3oz 65g or 235yds used needles 16in circular needle us 3/3 25mm 16in circular needle us 4/3 50mm 1 set us 4/3 50mm double-pointed needles 2 circulars or 1 long circular magic loop for crown decreases gauge 24 - 26 sts = 4in/10cm in stockinette stitch **dk weight yarn** approximately 2 65oz 75g 185yds used needles 16in circular needle us 5/3 75mm 16in circular needle us 7/4 5mm 1 set us 7/4 5 double-pointed needles 2 circulars or 1 long circular magic loop for crown decreases gauge 20 - 16 sts = 4in/10cm in stockinette stitch **bulky weight yarn** approximately 3 3oz 94g 116yds used needles 16in circular needle us 10/6mm 16in circular needle us 11/8mm 1 set us 11/8mm double-pointed needles 2 circulars or 1 long circular magic loop for crown decreases gauge 11 -
